candidates.name: Linda Jones
candidates.why_elect: I will make an excellent DHB member because I understand the difference between governance and management, I have a rational and pragmatic communication style, and I am fiscally responsible and literate. My personal health beliefs are holistic yet not incompatible with the DHBs more western and medical approach to health.
candidates.why_stand: My career is in health research, disseminating knowledge about health psychology and health promotion through lecturing and writing. I have recently returned to Taranaki so with a wealth of experience of service on boards and strategic governance groups, the DHB is the obvious way to contribute to my chosen community.

candidates.name: Kevin Nielsen
candidates.why_elect: Taranaki born and bred with an extensive career in newspapers (36 years, 16 as general manager) and hospice palliative care (15 years as CEO). I am involved in the disability sector through conductive education and riding for the disabled. He tangata he tangata—it is people, it is people.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about our province and our people and will do all I can to ensure that our health services are universally available and are of the highest standard. We are geographically somewhat isolated and we need strong advocacy which I am determined to provide.

candidates.name: Graeme Hamilton Sykes
candidates.why_elect: Born in New Plymouth I've recently returned to support whānau. Through my family I have experienced the complexity of medical and mental health issues that stifle creativity and happiness. I have a broad commercial experience in business, local government, clubs and charitable trusts at operational and governance levels.
candidates.why_stand: I'm fundamentally interested in developing community well-being. I want to see the Healthcare Model broaden from emergency to early detection and intervention systems. This involves more understanding, funding and collaboration to meet our community health and wellness needs. I'm experienced in market analysis with the aim to improve services.

candidates.name: Harry Duynhoven
candidates.why_elect: My experience with central and local government, together with involvement in many Taranaki voluntary organisations is unique on the TDHB. All of my career has been working with and for people from all walks of life. I'm a good team member, with considerable energy, aiming to achieve agreed outcomes.
candidates.why_stand: I'm born and brought up in New Plymouth and have always been totally committed to Taranaki. During my career as MP for New Plymouth and as Mayor I helped many local people access health care. I believe everyone should have a fair deal and appropriate, timely, health care provision.

candidates.name: Bev Gibson
candidates.why_elect: I am an RN, have a Masters in Management. I have worked in primary, secondary and in community health. I am currently an ACC clinical cultural advisor promoting and supporting clients in their rehabilitation journey. I believe I can make a positive difference endorsed by 40 years in the health sector.
candidates.why_stand: I believe in high-quality health service delivery for all people of Taranaki. I am a advocate for quality early intervention and prevention programmes, promoting physical activity, and engaging in healthy lifestyle initiatives. These elements will minimise GP visits, hospital care and allow people to enjoy life to the fullest.
